intro: Impatiens subabortiva, commonly known as the abortive impatiens, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are usually glossy and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique floral structure and growth habits make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
